page.title: 09LIFE STYLES IN WIMBOLDSLEY
page.content: {THE POPULATION}of Wimboldsley is growing after a fall as farm work became mechanised.People have modernised old cottages.There is a {green belt}around Wimboldsley, new houses can only be built where old buildings were.There is 1 street but no shops.There is a bread-van,milkman, butcher and fishmonger. The fishmonger beeps his horn to tell you he is here. There is a van with sweets and cakes. A library van comes every fortnight. The nearest swimmingpool is in Wins ford. There is a primary school with 37 pupils.There are lots of fields but you are not allowed to play in them. The village{Rosequeen }is the oldest girl in school.She leads procession of queens from Warmingham,Davenham,Byley and Middlewich.Stalls,Morris dancing and May pole by the children provide enjoyment and raise money for school.
